page.title: 06St. Mary's Church
page.content: Like the village of{Peldon,}the church of{St. Mary the Virgin}has its origins in the 11th century and is mentioned in the {Domesday Book.}It was probably an{Anglo-Saxon}building. The present church is{Norman}and the Nave dates back to the 12th century. The{Tower }was added in the 14th century, and the{Nave buttresses, roof and{Clerestory}were added in the 16th century. The modern church is flourishing, which reflects the fact that though Peldon is a very old village, it is still living and growing.
